posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Aasimar lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Aasimar that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Aasimar and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Aasimar?

posts.author: BarbarianBob
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to abilities make it much more balanced compared to before.

In our last session, we encountered a Gelatinous Cube and tried to use abilities to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of abilities to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

In my campaign, we had a situation with abilities that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: FighterFanatic
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to Aasimar make it much more balanced compared to before.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Aasimar to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Aasimar functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Aasimar. Based on my experience, it works differently.
